text: outlook is a simple email application with a good interface but is has some underlying flaw that have never been resolved in the year i have used it if you have an map email account anything besides exchange and mail then it can take over a minute to search for old mail and once you tap on the email it will never load there is no setting to have outlook download more than a few week of email so there is no way to make the search go faster and if you are in an area with no reception then you are screwed
original_text: Outlook is a simple email app with a good interface, but is has some underlying flaws that have never been resolved in the years I've used it. If you have an IMAP email account (anything besides Exchange and Gmail) then it can take over a minute to search for old emails, and once you tap on the email it will never load. There is no setting to have Outlook download more than a few weeks of email, so there is no way to make the search go faster, and if you're in an area with no reception then you are screwed.

text: i would expect much better performance from one of the top software developer in the world rule created in outlook do not carry over to mobile i continue to receive notification for mail i have elected to mark a read and move to folder in rule formatted text in signature doe not carry over to mobile my signature in new mail and reply is in plain text creates the opposite of a seamless transition search functionality in mobile is almost entirely pointless doe not provide any option of where to search and search doe not index all mail or even all of the mail in the active into can not find a way to view other people is calendar this should be a very obvious feature that is either hidden or nonexistent microsoft please update this application i am getting notification constantly from mail that are supposed to be being marked a read and moved to a separate folder if i turn notification off i do not receive important email notification or calendar notification but if i leave i turn notification off on i receive constant mail that i do not need to look at desktop to mobile should be a much more seamless transition
original_text: I would expect much better performance from one of the top software developers in the world.  1. Rules created in Outlook do not carry over to mobile. I continue to receive notifications for emails I have elected to "mark as read" and "move to folder" in Rules.  2. Formatted text in signature does not carry over to mobile. My signature in new emails, and replies is in plain text. Creates the opposite of a seamless transition.  3. Search functionality in mobile is almost entirely pointless. Does not provide any options of where to search, and search does not index all emails, or even all of the emails in the active inbox.  4. Cannot find a way to view other people's calendars. This should be a very obvious feature that is either hidden or non-existant.  Microsoft, PLEASE update this app! I am getting notifications constantly from emails that are supposed to be being marked as read and moved to a separate folder. If I turn notifications off, I don't receive important email notifications or calendar notifications, but if I leave them on, I receive constant emails that I don't need to look at. Desktop to mobile should be a much more seamless transition.

text: this email application is much better than other free email aps this email application work and look the same on pc tablet and phone if since singing phone contact to email contact work well saying contact in other email aps or account to outlook is very nice and work great i use lot of folder and sub-orders adding renaming moving deleting work easily the screen is clean with all function clearly identified no ad on phone or tablet similar to outlook office highly recommend
original_text: This email app is much better than other free email apps. It works and looks the same on PC, tablet and phone, if synced. Syncing phone contacts to email contacts works well. Syning contacts in other email apps or accounts to Outlook is very nice and works great. I use lots of folders and subfolders; adding, renaming, moving, deleting works easily. The screen is clean with all functions clearly identified. No ads on phone or tablet. Similar to Outlook Office 360. Highly Recommend.

text: ignores systemlevel muted notification and default notification sound had to separately disable sentreceived notification to avoid the phone chirping while using outlook no notification or obvious indicator when email received into any folder outside the into frequently have to manually scroll through the list is this better than most rd party corporate email client sure is this smart enough to be a reasonable competitor for mail not even close
original_text: Ignores system-level muted notifications and default notification sounds. Had to separately disable sent/received notifications to avoid the phone chirping while using Outlook. No notifications or obvious indicators when email received into any folder outside the inbox. Frequently have to manually scroll through the list. Is this better than most 3rd party corporate email clients? Sure. Is this smart enough to be a reasonable competitor for Gmail? Not even close.

text: this application has really screwed the pooch recently when i reply to an email internally then separately reply to an email internally the android version of this application include the internal reply too so that the external viewer can see all the inadequate fix is now to include the warning external sender it is like the developer do not know how business is conducted external email we decline payment of your invoice because we are a hostile client forwarded internally can you funding believe this guy external email we would appreciate prompt payment though in the style of trump business style management we understand that you want to renegotiate after the fact client see both internal and external mail what a moronic backwards step in email functionality further inconsistency between handheld application and desktop new mail are at the bottom not the top why why inconsistency inefficiency i have lost so much functionality in the pocket application that i no longer trust this application also when i mark an email a unread every previous email in the thread is marked the same wasting my time
original_text: This app has really screwed the pooch recently. When I reply to an email internally, then separately reply to the same email internally, the Android version of the app include the internal reply too so that the external viewer can see all. The inadequate "fix" is now to include the warning "external sender". It's like the developers don't know how business is conducted.  External email: "We decline payment of your invoice because we are a hostile client"  Forwarded internally "Can you fu*&ing believe this guy?!". External email "We would appreciate prompt payment, though in the style of Trump business style management we understand that you want to renegotiate after the fact". Client sees both internal and external emails. What a moronic backwards step in email "functionality".  Further inconsistencies between handheld app and desktop: new emails are at the bottom, not the top. Why?! WHY!!?? Inconsistency = inefficiency.  I have lost so much functionality in the pocket app that I no longer trust this app. Also, when I mark an email as "unread", every previous email in the thread is marked the same. Wasting my time!!

I thought I was stuck with this app because of my work email but I figured out how to sync it to Gmail. Uninstalled this app and my phone runs better. And emails are better formated with Gmail, this app wouldn't display tables the same as in desktop, which are frequently used where I work, and instead create a jumbled mess.

text: what a huge disappointment a the maker of exchange you would expect microsoft to understand mail rule and mail sorting with rule that sort mail into sub-orders automatically on exchange one requires the ability to sync or not sync those folder in outlook sub folder singing is a pretty basic feature i would expect from an application carrying the name outlook if all your mail only go to your into all your mail only go to your into not bad but i will stick with ted feature rich nine email application
original_text: What a HUGE disappointment. As the makers of exchange, you would expect Microsoft to understand mail rules and mail sorting. With rules that sort mail into subfolders automatically on exchange, one requires the ability to sync (or NOT) sync those folders in Outlook. Sub folder syncing is a pretty basic feature I would expect from an app carrying the name "Outlook". If all your mail only goes to your inbox... Its not bad. But I'll stick with tgd feature rich Nine email app.

text: the focused into is a great feature and one that outlook doe better than most the ui is really nice especially after the upgrade and the customisable swipe setting in both direction are excellent great email client all around only real gripe is it is handling of attachment occasionally they are not displayed at all while i can access they via other email client i think the issue is most apparent when the sender is using outlook on a desktop
original_text: The 'Focused' inbox is a great feature and one that Outlook does better than most. The UI is really nice, especially after the 2.0 upgrade and the customizable swipe settings (in both directions) are excellent. Great email client all around. Only real gripe is it's handling of attachments. Occasionally they are not displayed at all while I can access them via other email clients. I think the issue is most apparent when the sender is using outlook on a desktop.

text: the application work decently enough i have to say that mail show up and you can read mail i like the baltic feedback when i wipe away mail but i can not recommend using this a your daily driver especially for work related mail and the simple reason for that is that this application will keep losing your credential and account setting just when you start wondering why no more mail show up you open this application just to realize that yes you have to enter your map server address and password again not only doe this application not tell you this application lost the credential a simple push notification would suffice meaning you miss out on potentially day of mail and i did but then it is the added hassle of having to find your information again it department will hate you forever so again i do not recommend using this application i do not dislike this application per se it could be faster and better at rendering mail show up too big or too small and zooming will be disabled but losing my credential again and again my last review which i wrote five year ago when i got my first android phone said basically the same thing make this application to unreliable to be a daily driver i need them mail
original_text: The app works decently enough, I have to say that. Mails show up, and you can read them. I like the haptic feedback when I wipe away mails.  But I can't recommend using this as your daily driver, especially for work related mails. And the simple reason for that is that THIS APP WILL KEEP LOSING YOUR CREDENTIALS AND ACCOUNT SETTINGS.  Just when you start wondering why no more mails show up, you open the app just to realize that, yes, you have to enter your imap server address and password again.  Not only does the app not tell you it lost the credentials (a simple push notification would suffice!!) meaning you miss out on potentially days of mails (and I did), but then it's the added hassle of having to find your information again. IT departments will hate you forever.  So again, I don't recommend using the app. I don't dislike it per se. It could be faster, and better at rendering. Mails show up too big, or too small, and zooming will be disabled. But losing my credentials, again and again (my last review, which I wrote five years ago when I got my first android phone said basically the same thing) makes this app to unreliable to be a daily driver. I needs them mails.

text: overall it is a big improvement over older version but it is still missing a lot of useful functionality of rd party email client like going to nextprevious email after deleting picture in signature and most importantly you can not see more folder like sent etc in single view together with into updated review after week down to star contact are since with the phone but contact are read-only there is no instruction on how to make contact fully editable you also can not see the note associated with the contact because outlook make the contact the contact is read-only it is a really nice fast and usable email client but with problem listed above i can not recommend this application anymore
original_text: Overall: It's a big improvement over older versions but it's still missing a lot of useful functionality of 3rd party email clients like going to next/previous email after deleting, picture in signature, and most importantly you cannot see more folders like sent, etc in single view together with Inbox.  Updated review after 2 weeks, down to 2 stars. Contacts are synced with the phone but they are "read-only" there is no instructions on how to make them fully editable. You also cannot see the notes associated with the contact because outlook makes them ""This contact is read-only".  It's a really nice, fast, and usable email client, but with problems listed above, I cannot recommend this app anymore.

text: why can not we just see threaded conversation in a collapsed view when you open a conversation they are all expanded and you have to scroll with your finger forever to get to the message you want it is amazing how microsoft still could not figure out the basic functionality of a user interface that other company have been able to do so a decade ago dear microsoft threaded conversation if dear microsoft threaded conversation are read already start collapsed you expand dear microsoft threaded conversation at your ease by tapping on each conversation and there is an option to expand or collapse dear microsoft threaded conversation there i felt like i wrote to an online suggestion thread that started a decade ago but maybe this time microsoft is listening
original_text: Why can't we just see threaded conversations in a collapsed view?  When you open a conversation, they are all expanded and you have to scroll with your fingers forever to get to the message you want.  It's amazing how Microsoft still could not figure out the basic functionality of a user interface that other companies have been able to do so a decade ago. Dear Microsoft, threaded conversations, if they are read already, start collapsed (you expand them at your ease by tapping on each conversation) and there is an option to expand or collapse them.  There... I felt like I wrote to an online suggestion thread that started a decade ago. But, maybe this time Microsoft is listening.

text: no-nonsense and reliable function i have alternated between using this and the mail application for work outlook application advantage this and the mail application for work has some of the top level organization and feature of the outlook desktop version including the focused and other box to allow for more focus on important email outlook application disadvantage the calendar is not a versatile a goole is such a not including shared calendar but it is much le buggy than previous version
original_text: No-nonsense & reliable functions. I've alternated between using this and the Gmail app (for work). Outlook app advantages: it has some of the top level organization and features of the Outlook desktop version, including the "Focused" and "Other" boxes - to allow for more focus on important emails. Outlook app disadvantage: the calendar isn't as versatile as Google's, such as not including shared calendars, but it's much less buggy than previous versions.

text: update april another month of development and public folder are still not supported hey microsoft exchange public folder are your idea and this is your application for accessing email why do you continue to keep acet to public folder limit original review sept agh still no access to public folder business user like me really need this it is otherwise clean and easy to use but lack the power of the nine email and calendar application and the calendar still has none of the beauty of the sunrise calendar application microsoft bought and scuppered a year or so ago it seems pointless to acquire such a polished application then just kill such a polished application without using any of the style and feature that made such a polished application such an outstanding calendar uninstaled after a week i will be sticking with nine
original_text: **UPDATE - April '19** Another 18 months of 'development' and Public Folders are still not supported.  Hey, Microsoft - Exchange Public Folders are YOUR idea and this is YOUR app for accessing email - why do you continue to keep accesst to Public Folders 'off-limits'?    ------------------------------Original review, Sept '17:  Aagh! Still no access to Public Folders - Business users like me really need this.  It's otherwise clean and easy to use, but lacks the power of the 'Nine' email and calendar app. and the calendar still has none of the beauty of the Sunrise calendar app Microsoft bought and scuppered a year or so ago.  It seems pointless to acquire such a polished app then just kill it without using any of the style and features that made it such an outstanding calendar.  Uninstalled after a week - I'll be sticking with 'Nine'.
